intro: Achyranthes setacea, commonly known as the hairy smartweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features erect stems covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a serrated margin and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red. Its fruit is a three-lobed capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Achyranthes setacea is often found in moist soils along stream banks, wetlands, and disturbed areas.
